post_text: Red Knight alum Isabel Santiago is rocking the arts. Check out her clay animation! #RSDproud
shared_text:
Isabel Santiago
June 6 at 1:20 PM · Instagram ·

Atlas and P. Jean meet for the first time! 💛 I started this animation two weeks ago with one idea in mind- make a 60 sec. animation for Black and Afro-Latino kids to SEE themselves being awesome in claymation! I wish I had a cartoon that looked like me while growing up- a cartoon, a picture book character, a movie, a puppet, a stop-motion... ANYTHING. That never happened for me as a kid, so I’d like to change that in some way 🌈. Discovering what I can create during quarantine has sent me on a new and exciting mission— Izzy’s Clay House pledges to be a place where BIPOC kids can SEE THEMSELVES navigating the real and imaginary world with POWER, whimsy, magic, and a bit of claymation! A space for ALL kids, big and small. 💛 .
.
All clay animation. Music by me and a loop machine.
.
.

Berks County Public Libraries and RACC

Reading Public Library
April 15 at 3:39 PM ·

Don't have a library card? You can get a card online for RPL or any other Berks county public library. We'll get back to you within 24-48 hours with your digital "card". Here's how:

Go to : https://bit.ly/GetCardedToday (or click below)
Select your home library and enter your postal code.
Click “Continue”.
Fill out the online form.
You'll be asked to visit your local library after the libraries reopen to show a photo id to verify your account. But you can start borrowing from our digital resources as soon as you get your online "card".

Overdrive is available to all Berks County libraries. Hoopla is available for Reading, Schuylkill Valley, and Wernersville libraries. If you have questions or difficulty with the online card registration you can call our Reference department at 610.655.6355. We are still answering phone calls during the COVID-19 shutdown.

April 15 at 3:39 PM ·

Don't have a library card? You can get a card online for RPL or any other Berks county public library. We'll get back to you within 24-48 hours with your digital "card". Here's how:

Go to : https://bit.ly/GetCardedToday (or click below)
Select your home library and enter your postal code.
Click “Continue”.
Fill out the online form.
You'll be asked to visit your local library after the libraries reopen to show a photo id to verify your account. But you can start borrowing from our digital resources as soon as you get your online "card".

Overdrive is available to all Berks County libraries. Hoopla is available for Reading, Schuylkill Valley, and Wernersville libraries. If you have questions or difficulty with the online card registration you can call our Reference department at 610.655.6355. We are still answering phone calls during the COVID-19 shutdown.
